summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 24, 2020, commanding an individual to appear before the grand jury on August 23, 2020, to testify and produce documents related to alleged violations of federal statutes including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to maintain confidentiality.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony being conducted by a federal grand jury.

The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), 371 (conspiracy), and 1623 (false statements).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the recipient to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The recipient is commanded to appear on August 23, 2020, at 10:00 a.m. and to produce items listed in an attached rider.
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and may result in civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
